group_1.narration: After we exchanged numbers,@we'd text each other and@meet up every now and then.
We'd vent about our homes whenever@we got together and it was so nice@getting all of that off my chest.
But those good times didn't last long...
After hanging out a few times,@I started finding things that really@bothered me about Tsukuyo...

group_1.textRight: Wow! This tea is sooo good!
S-sorry. Hey, how much is this?

group_1.textLeft: It's one thousand yen per glass if you@must know.

group_1.textRight: A...thousand?! Just for boiling up some@leaves?!

group_1.textLeft: What did I tell you, Tsukasa?!

group_1.narration: Tsukuyo being all mannerly and polished@made her look like a stuck up know-it-all...

group_1.textLeft: Do you mind if we see what that store over@there has for purchase?

group_1.textRight: Huh? We're students, remember? That place@is really expensive...

group_1.textLeft: You concern yourself too much with such@trivial matters.

group_1.textRight: Students like us wearing those clothes@would just make us look ridiculous.

group_1.narration: Tsukuyo's obsession with her looks@and behavior made it seem like she was@bragging about how well-off she was...

group_1.textRight: Your friend there, is she your sister?

group_1.textLeft: No, just a relative. We're really close@though.

group_1.textRight: The way you two carry yourselves is much@too different.

group_1.narration: Whenever she'd start talking with someone@else, I became nothing more than something@to make Tsukuyo look better...
I'd find even more differences@every time we saw each other.
Thinking about it now, I was just jealous.
The environments in which we grew up@were different, but I couldn't accept that.@I just wasn't mature enough back then.
I was starting to think Tsukuyo was arrogant,@even though she was the only friend I could@truly be honest with.
Even worse, anger and resentment began to@build up right along with those thoughts.

group_1.textLeft: You've been staying out late a lot lately.@Something going on?

group_1.textRight: I made a friend, that's all.
Yes, it's just she lives so far away that@it takes me a while to get home.

group_1.textLeft: And yet you're still finishing your chores.@I'm impressed.
If she is, break it off now. You'll end up@like me...

group_1.textRight: Dad, this has nothing to do with what@happened between you and Mom!

group_1.textLeft: The lifestyles we lived and the upbringings@ingrained in us clashed too drastically.
Trying to bridge that gap with love was just@too hard to do.
You can never be too careful when@becoming friends with outsiders.
When your relationship deteriorates, it'll@break and never go back to normal.

group_1.narration: My anger and frustration towards@Tsukuyo was already at its peak@when Dad talked to me about that.
His words carved deep into my heart...
